Blog.post: urlLink Meet my phobia. In spite of the fact that I am absolutely terrified of clouds, I also find them absolutely beautiful. This is portrait painted in the sky, by God, when we arrived at Pagudpud almost 3 weeks ago. urlLink
urlLink Ola! Coming straight from urlLink Crevices , this is Pammu, birthing a photoblog. My thanks to Bunny for taking this shot :) urlLink

urlLink Reunion at home. Tita Geny laughing her head off. I think they were talking how everyone first met their spouses. I normally stay with the "grown ups" for conversations like these. Great book ideas *rubs hands* urlLink
urlLink Dad and me standing next to what would be salad. urlLink

urlLink Faux Hong Kong. This is the tippity top of Tagaytay HIghlands. The building at the back is a steak house on the second floor (imagine eating steak with an awesome view!), and a cable leading to the golf course to the bottom of the Club. Notice the fog. Fog means that my taking this shot is asking for too much. For all I care, this shot costs a thousand bucks! *makes not to self* urlLink
urlLink Coffee and a Bunny. Not included in view: An overlooking panorama of Cavite and Laguna de Bay. urlLink
urlLink Nature shot. Bougainvillas on fire. urlLink

urlLink Meet my phobia 2. On the same day that I took this, a bird crached into the window and managed to reorient its flight after a 2 second drop. I on the other hand, stripped myself of cloud fear to take this shot. Congratulate me :) urlLink
urlLink Be freaked out. urlLink
urlLink Kinda blurry, but that's the Bosuego family. Including the dog. urlLink
urlLink Banjo in Danielle's room, checking out his Friendster. Close sila, 'no? urlLink
urlLink Another sassy Julia pic. This is not a Mirinda ad, mind you... urlLink
urlLink Beggar cat at Tagaytay's Ryan and Kaye restaurant. My pasalubong for Rod. urlLink
urlLink Gorgeous is all it is :) urlLink
urlLink Bastu-os! urlLink
urlLink Alan and I, and Tin on the corner. Never thought that this pic would look fabulous. Thanks Tito Elmer! urlLink
urlLink It's almost as if Tita Geny's sun glasses are on my face instead of on hers... urlLink
urlLink Bossom buddies Danielle and Pam urlLink

urlLink The family eats The Aristocrat in Malate, after 30 minutes of walking back and forth, and after causing an awkward standing presence in the restaurant. Rod is answering the kiddie place mat on whimsical fun, and he faces Tito Nick. Julia, is slowly getting tired as the night progresses while Danielle, Tita Gina and Jenny talk about something. Not seen in the picture are Tito Elmer and Pam. urlLink
urlLink Smiling at Malate. Uso na pala sa pamilya and impromptu na gimmick pagkatapos ng bigating salu-salo sa bahay. Btw, and daming singit...k lang... urlLink
urlLink Julia being perky. Instead of reciting some predictable nursery rhyme for me, she makes a weird face, which still looks cute. urlLink
urlLink Julian with Camille. Pardon the weird flash :) urlLink
urlLink Guess where Julia got the spunk? Smashing urlLink
urlLink Jamming it with Tita Elvie and Neil urlLink
urlLink Alan, a victim of amatuer false perspective. Or, you can just think that Alan is jumping . As he does when he makes kwento urlLink
urlLink The boys. Playing with the computer. I am sorry to say that this is, well, a normal thing. Oh well. That's Emeric, Mickey, Rod, Banjo, and Alan. urlLink
urlLink Julia's sister. The third Pam in the family. A very fortunate family, this :) urlLink
urlLink Meet some spunk. This is the Julia. urlLink

urlLink Jonathan and Georgia got their shots today. Georgia, aware, of something happening, ran across the backyard to and from in a straight line. Jonathan, surprisingly, was calm. Emphasis on surprisingly urlLink
urlLink Gee, I never knew our backyard looked so much like a resort. urlLink
urlLink The view from my room. This is the view that also houses the sorry sounding karaoke parties. Go figure why I hate karaoke and videoke... urlLink
